channel.title: Steam Greenlight. A chance for BM on Steam?
channel.description:
Look at this: [url='https://steamcommunity.com/greenlight/']https://steamcommunity.com/greenlight/[/url] Basicly it says anyone can put his game on a voting list called Steam Greenlight. Users will then vote for it to get it on Steam or not. The game doesn't have to be finished to be on Greenlight. The service starts at August.
If the games posted on Greenlight can be free to play there is no restriciton for Black Mesa to be put on Steam.

item.source: Steam Greenlight. A chance for BM on Steam?

item.title: Steam Greenlight. A chance for BM on Steam?
item.dc:creator: higgsboson
item.description:
mankyman6:

Greatly appreciate it, devs!

It’s at 18% now! That’s the highest I’ve seen any greenlight go, so far. Damn.

I don’t get this percentage thing. 18% of what? Why can’t they just write “300 out of the required 2000 votes reached” or something?

And how many votes do they even need? I mean, for Black Mesa, I’m pretty sure it will get more votes than anything else, and if even that’s not enough, then their system is very unrealistic…

Read full topic

There’s 9 days left. People could make a huge push using facebook and make this the #1 voted game on this new greenlight thing.

There are tons of user mods on there now, Cry of Fear, a bunch.

WHERE’S BMS AT? Its the perfect feather in the cap for your final media push.
